docs.lead_paragraph: The houses on Boynton Street have all gone blind. The windows used to peer out on a real neighborhood, on children who chased softballs down the narrow street, on women who filed into Eloise Mealing's beauty shop and came out looking good.

headline.main: Pollution Drives Away Neighborhood and Trust

docs.abstract: Blue-collar, black neighborhood of Anniston, Ala, which coexisted with nearby Monsanto chemical plant since 1930's, is contaminated with toxic polychlorinated biphenyls, manufactured there for four decades; pollution from PCB's has made area unfit for people; many homes have been boarded up and people have left; more than 1,000 people, residents past and present, are suing Monsanto for destruction of their neighborhoods, and for myriad medical concerns as yet not proved to have any connection with PCB's; photos (L)
docs.snippet: The houses on Boynton Street have all gone blind.    The windows used to peer out on a real neighborhood, on children who chased softballs down the narrow street, on women who filed into Eloise Mealing's beauty shop and came out looking good.
